name: Bilateral Renal Medullary Carcinoma with Paraneoplastic Syndrome
chief_complaint: Severe flank pain and blood in my urine for the past two weeks
symptoms: unintentional weight loss (15 lbs in 3 months)
physical_findings: palpable abdominal mass in both flanks

lab_results.CT urogram: bilateral infiltrative renal masses with retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy

treatment: consideration for experimental immunotherapy given poor response to traditional chemotherapy
prognosis: extremely poor (median survival <12 months even with treatment)
description: A rare, highly aggressive malignancy arising from the renal medulla, almost exclusively seen in young patients with sickle cell trait or disease. Characterized by rapid bilateral involvement, early metastasis, and frequent paraneoplastic phenomena. Often misdiagnosed initially as pyelonephritis or renal infarction.
